description: just the right niche of an app for my daily writings. i appreciate the calendar view on the left side that highlights days i've written so if i ever want to go back i know what days to revisit. not imposing on my desktop when using either, and the password protection is a nice touch.
And the look & feel is so clean. Exactly what I needed. Thanks.
Simple and useful app. Highly recommend to install.

Just what I was looking for when considering keeping a digital diary. I like how a blank page is presented to me whenever I boot my machine (it runs at startup) where I can just start writing, without bothering about noting the date first. In other words, it encourages me to write, which is what I need. 
Only bug (?) so far is that the text panel not automatically scrolling down with longer texts.
nice app...recommended to use

It seems to freeze every so often and it then doesnt save any additional texts.

Also copying thows up an error (click and drag)

I then have to unistall and reinstall.

A great little app for a personal diary on Linux operating systems.

It isn't intrusive, doesn't overpower you with its user interface and has just the right amount of tools to keep you happy with privacy etc...

I recommend this app to everyone!
summary: As good as Journey and DayOne for Linux systems!

description: The app "forgot" my password after a week of usage and thereafter I couldn't use the app or reset the password. Lost everything
summary: Absolute Disaster - lost all of my diary

description: Very nice and simple diary.
App looks quite nice. Just wondering how you back up data and restore if there was a problem.
summary: Looks good - question - how do you back up the data?

description: have not found a any diary like this.
How can I disable autocorrenct?? I write the diary in another language than english and all those red lines are distracting me
It's clean and nice.

A really simple app, just what you're looking for.
Maybe giving the choice of adding one picture a day would be nice too.
summary: It is so simple light and nice

description:
A wonderful app, nearly flawless execution.

The app does behave a bit strangely when you get to the bottom of the text box, and for some reason, there is no list of suggestions with spell checking.

That aside, all the functionality you could want for is here. Its a simple text-based diary, and it fulfils that roll wonderfully.
Please introduce shortcut keys for adding bullets/numbered list

I have always wanted a diary like this i was fed up with other such apps. This is neat.
Thanks dev!!
ありがと
Otherwise it is perfect to write.
summary: Nice app, but please tell how to enable dark theme

description: I was great and usfull for me but i think it will be better if it had Sync to google drive or dropbox option and it automacticly save the json file on cloud
summary: The Greatest Diary app ever for linux

description: I needed a little side panel with my to-do tasks to pop up every day next to the diary. Solved it with a "Tasks - todo" in an old non-used diary entry. Just search "todo" and it pops up on the side. Copy past into the diary when task is done.
summary: Works perfect for my purpose now

description: Snap Stoe version needs spell check, other than that it's not a bad app.
Nice and easy to use
Love the dark mode support most
This app is simple, and user friendly. Which makes it excellent for the use of my psychic Being. And how it saves automatically, is very nice.

Wow, this is is wonderful application. It provide simple and accurate functionality to focus on writing. I am really impress with design and simplicity of this app. Also this is completly free. Highly recommend to use this app and make good habit.

Thank you Samuel Meuli for this wonderful application. 
Lot's of love.

I am really impressed by this app. Does exactly what it needs to do and nothing more. Super clean and self-explaining app. Sad that it is not maintained any longer. Still hoping that someone will do the job to keep it working.

I daily log what I do during my work day on mini-diary. I love the 'search' functionality. I take notes about the new commands(codes, any stuff actually) I learn during the day, and when I forget them I just type in the search box, and there, they are! It is very simple to use and your privacy is under protection. Unless somebody knows your password, nobody can log in to see what you wrote. Only, I wish it had an online connection and syncing in different computers. I use this on Ubuntu, but my work computer is OpenSuse and it had a sync function I would easily sync my computers. Hope this feature comes in future! Great work, appreciated. Thank you!
As a word processor this is terrible. The only novelty is the feature to password protect open documents so they cannot be viewed or altered by somebody that does not have the password for the app.
App developer recommends getting another app diary.
Debe mejorar. Pero agradezco su esfuerzo por el software libre y gratuito.
summary: Simplemente no arranca. Reinstale y no funcionó

description: Полезное приложение.
